SEARCH
Package org.drivers

Class DriverControllerDomain

java.lang.Object
org.drivers.DriverControllerDomain
public class DriverControllerDomain extends Object
DriverControllerDomain class. Handles the main user interface through a text-based menu system. Provides interaction with the ControllerDomain to manage products, shelves, and data parsing.
Version:
1.0

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DriverControllerDomain(ControllerDomain controllerDomain)
    Constructs a DriverControllerDomain instance with a specified ControllerDomain.

  • Constructor Details

    • DriverControllerDomain

      public DriverControllerDomain(ControllerDomain controllerDomain)
      Constructs a DriverControllerDomain instance with a specified ControllerDomain.

      This constructor initializes the DriverControllerDomain with a given ControllerDomain object and sets up a scanner for user input.

      Parameters:
      controllerDomain - the ControllerDomain object to be associated with this DriverControllerDomain

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method to run the DriverControllerDomain class.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments passed to the application (not used)

    • showLoginRegistrationMenu

      public void showLoginRegistrationMenu()
      Displays the login and registration menu.

      This method presents a menu to the user with options to log in, register, or exit. It processes the user's input and navigates to the corresponding action based on the selected option. The loop continues until the user selects option 0 to exit.

    • login

      public void login()
      Handles the login process for the user.

      Prompts the user to input their username (or email) and password, hashes the password for security, and attempts to log in using the provided credentials. If successful, the user is redirected to the main menu. If login fails due to unauthorized access, an error message is displayed.

    • register

      public void register()
      Handles the user registration process.

      Prompts the user to input their username, email, password, and confirmation password. Validates that the password and confirmation password match before attempting to register the user. If registration fails due to invalid input or unauthorized access, an appropriate error message is displayed.

      Throws:
      UserException - if the provided passwords do not match or there is an issue with user input.

    • showMenu

      public void showMenu()
      Displays a menu of options and processes user input.

      This method presents a menu to the user with several options related to files, products, and shelves. It processes the user's input and navigates to the corresponding menu based on the selected option. The loop continues until the user selects option 0 to exit.

    • showShelfMenu

      public void showShelfMenu()
      Displays the shelf-related menu and processes user input for shelf-related actions.

      This method presents a menu to the user with various options related to shelves, such as creating a shelf, changing sorting algorithms, showing shelf details, modifying distributions, and more. It processes the user's input and performs the corresponding action based on the selected option. The loop continues until the user selects option 0 to exit the menu.

    • showParserMenu

      public void showParserMenu()
      Displays the file-related menu and processes user input for file operations.

      This method presents a menu to the user with options to read data from an external file, create a file with the distribution, or exit the menu. It processes the user's input and performs the corresponding action based on the selected option. The loop continues until the user selects option 0 to exit the menu.

    • showProductMenu

      public void showProductMenu()
      Displays the product-related menu and processes user input for product operations.

      This method presents a menu to the user with various options related to product management, such as adding/removing products, changing quantities, managing product lists, applying discounts, and more. It processes the user's input and performs the corresponding action based on the selected option. The loop continues until the user selects option 0 to exit the menu.

    • modifyDistribution

      public void modifyDistribution()
      Modifies the distribution by updating the relationship between two specified products.

      This method prompts the user to enter the names of a distribution and two products. It then calls the modifyDistribution method of the controllerDomain to modify the distribution. If the modification is successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If an error occurs, the exception message is displayed.

    • createNewDistribution

      public void createNewDistribution()
      Facilitates the creation of a new distribution by interacting with the user through the console. This method prompts the user to input the ID of a shelf and the name of the distribution. It then invokes the domain controller to create the distribution. If an error occurs, it catches and displays the corresponding exception message.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided shelf ID is not an integer.

    • removeList

      public void removeList()
      Removes a product list from the system.

      This method prompts the user to enter the name of the product list they wish to remove. It then calls the removeProductList method of the controllerDomain to remove the list. If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If an error occurs, such as the list being associated with a shelf or other issues, the exception message is displayed.

    • changeProductListAtShelf

      public void changeProductListAtShelf()
      Changes the product list associated with a specific shelf.

      This method prompts the user to enter the shelf ID and the name of the product list they want to associate with the shelf. It then calls the changeProductListAtShelf method of the controllerDomain to update the association. If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If an error occurs, such as an invalid shelf ID, invalid list name, or other exceptions, the respective error message is shown.

    • showOperationLog

      public void showOperationLog()
      Displays the history of changes made to product lists.

      This method retrieves the history of changes in the product lists by calling the showOperationLog method of the controllerDomain and then displays the retrieved information to the user. Displays the history of changes made to product lists.

      This method retrieves the history of changes in the product lists by calling the showListChanges method of the controllerDomain and then displays the retrieved information to the user.

    • increaseProductQuantity

      public void increaseProductQuantity()
      Increases the quantity of a specified product in the system.

      This method prompts the user to enter the product name and the quantity to be added. It then calls the increaseProductQuantity method of the controllerDomain to update the product's quantity. If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If an error occurs, such as an invalid product name or quantity, the respective exception message is shown.

    • decreaseProductQuantity

      public void decreaseProductQuantity()
      Decreases the quantity of a specified product in the system.

      This method prompts the user to enter the product name and the quantity to be reduced. It then calls the decreaseProductQuantity method of the controllerDomain to update the product's quantity. If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If an error occurs, such as an invalid product name or quantity, the respective exception message is shown.

    • applyDiscountToList

      public void applyDiscountToList()
      Applies a discount to a specified product list.

      This method prompts the user to enter the name of the product list and the discount percentage to be applied. It then calls the applyDiscountToList method of the controllerDomain to apply the discount. If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If an error occurs, such as an invalid list name or discount value, the respective exception message is shown.

    • createNewProductList

      public void createNewProductList()
      Creates a new product list with a specified name and category.

      This method prompts the user to enter the name and category for the new product list. It then calls the createProductList method of the controllerDomain to create the list. If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If an error occurs, such as an invalid list name or category, the respective exception message is shown.

    • showAllProductsCatalog

      public void showAllProductsCatalog()
      Displays all products in the catalog.

      This method retrieves the list of all products from the catalog by calling the getAllProductsCatalog method of the controllerDomain. It then iterates through the list of products and prints the details of each product. A placeholder message is shown before listing the products.

    • showSimilarity

      public void showSimilarity()
      Displays the similarities between products.

      This method retrieves the product similarities by calling the showSimilarity method of the controllerDomain. It then prints the retrieved information, showing the similarities between products in the system.

    • changeSimilarity

      public void changeSimilarity()
      Changes the similarity value between two products.

      This method prompts the user for the names of two products and the new similarity value between them. It then removes the existing similarity between the two products and adds the updated similarity. If the user provides an invalid similarity value (non-double), an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      The method calls controllerDomain.removeSimilarity and controllerDomain.addSimilarity to update the similarity between the products.

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the similarity value provided is not a valid double.

    • addProductToCatalog

      public void addProductToCatalog()
      Adds a new product to the product catalog.

      This method prompts the user to input details for a new product, including its name, category, price, and available quantity. The user is also prompted to input similarity values between the new product and other products already in the catalog. The similarity values are stored as pairs of product names and similarity values (of type double).

      The method then calls controllerDomain.addProductToCatalog to add the product to the catalog with the specified details and similarities.

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any input value is not of the expected type, such as a non-numeric price or quantity.

    • addProductToList

      public void addProductToList()
      Adds a product to a specified product list.

      This method prompts the user to input the name of the product and the name of the list to which the product should be added. The method then calls controllerDomain.addProductToList to add the product to the specified list.

      If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If any error occurs (e.g., invalid product or list), an appropriate error message is shown.

    • removeProductFromList

      public void removeProductFromList()
      Removes a product from a specified product list.

      This method prompts the user to input the name of the product and the name of the list from which the product should be removed. The method then calls controllerDomain.removeProductFromList to remove the product from the specified list.

      If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If any error occurs (e.g., invalid product or list), an appropriate error message is shown.

    • removeProductFromCatalog

      public void removeProductFromCatalog()
      Removes a product from the catalog.

      This method prompts the user to input the name of the product that should be removed from the catalog. It then calls controllerDomain.removeProductFromCatalog to remove the product from the system's catalog.

      If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If the product is not found or there is an issue with the product, an error message is shown.

    • showAllLists

      public void showAllLists()
      Displays all product lists in the system.

      This method retrieves and displays all the product lists available in the system by calling controllerDomain.showAllLists. It prints the result to the console.

      The method provides a summary of all the lists managed by the system.

    • showListContent

      public void showListContent()
      Displays the content of a specific product list.

      This method prompts the user to enter the name of a product list, retrieves the list from the system, and then displays its content. If the list is not found or any issue arises, an appropriate error message is shown.

    • createShelf

      public void createShelf()
      Creates a new shelf with the specified attributes and associates it with a product list and sorting algorithm.

      This method prompts the user to enter the necessary information such as the shelf ID, size, associated product list, and algorithm type, and then calls the controller to create the shelf. If any input is invalid or missing, an error message is displayed.

    • changeShelfAlgorithm

      public void changeShelfAlgorithm()
      Changes the algorithm associated with a shelf.

      This method prompts the user to enter the shelf ID and the algorithm type (either Backtrack or Hill Climbing) to associate with the shelf. If the input is valid, it updates the shelf's algorithm. If any input is invalid or missing, an error message is displayed.

    • showAllShelfs

      public void showAllShelfs()
      Displays all the shelves in the system.

      This method retrieves and prints out a list of all the shelves available in the system. If there are no shelves or the system encounters an issue, an appropriate message will be displayed.

    • showShelf

      public void showShelf()
      Displays the details of a shelf based on its ID.

      This method prompts the user for a shelf ID, validates the input, and then retrieves and displays the details of the shelf with that ID from the system. If the provided ID is invalid or the shelf cannot be found, an appropriate error message will be shown.

    • showDistributionShelf

      public void showDistributionShelf()
      Displays the distribution details of a shelf based on its ID.

      This method prompts the user to input a shelf ID, validates the input, and retrieves the distribution information of the specified shelf from the system. The details are then displayed to the user. If the provided ID is invalid or the shelf cannot be found, an appropriate error message will be shown.

    • getDataThroughFile

      public void getDataThroughFile()
      Loads data from a file specified by the user.

      This method prompts the user to input the file path where the data is located. It then attempts to load the data from the file through the controller domain. If successful, a confirmation message is displayed. If there is an issue with the file path or data format, an appropriate error message is shown.

    • crateNewDistributionFile

      public void crateNewDistributionFile()
      Creates a new distribution file based on the specified shelf and file information.

      This method prompts the user for the name and path of the new file, as well as the shelf ID. It then attempts to create a new distribution file using the provided information. If the file creation is successful, a confirmation message is displayed. In case of errors such as invalid shelf ID, file path issues, or other exceptions, an appropriate error message is shown.
